segments.text: Everyone watches over me, and someone sits back in the store
With eyes that say, hands that feel
Why am I the last to know sheltered life spent partially breathing?
Gathered together under new religion
Pulling punches, moving, sleeping on our feet
Pulling punches, I needed someone to comfort me
Raised in summer days of splendor
Would have dreamed of love never ending
A better world lies in front of me
A sketch of life and the books I read
Then as I walk where heaven leads
Why am I the last to know simple lives spent partially breathing?
Gathered together under new religion
Pulling punches, moving, sleeping on our feet
Pulling punches, I needed someone to comfort me
Raised in summer days of splendor
Would have dreamed of love never ending
Nature leads
There's no zeal
Deep inside the heart of new
Sheltered lives spent partially breathing
Gathered together under new religion
Pulling punches, moving, sleeping on our feet
Pulling punches, I needed someone to comfort me
Raised in summer days of splendor
Would have dreamed of love never ending
